intro: Gilibertia cuneata var. abbreviata, commonly known as the shortleaf gilibertia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are small and yellowish. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its distinctive foliage.
